comment: I took his pre-calc the first semester he started teaching and I was kind of scared not gonna lie. It was math so the homework wasn't the most fun but I did enjoy his lectures and he provided amazing notes that you could write on and it made everything so much more clear. Truly a wonderful professor! Take him if you can!
An AMAZING professor, he is patient and very understanding. He helps as much as he can and is very descriptive with explanations. As long as you pay attention i would say the class is super easy.
He is a good professor. His tests are easy. I barely made to his class and still ending up with A+. (I am not recommending this if you are not good at math.) The study guides are similar to tests.

The BEST professor I could've taken. He gives good explanations for his lectures. Sadly, I didn't pass due to my procrastination and not finishing Aleks in time. Honestly, to pass, you just need to put in the work and memorization. The exams are easy if you study, and he will provide study guides exactly like the tests that are given.

He is an interesting professor. He uses notes made by the university, which is not really relevant to his method of doing the equations. His grading is very clear and ALEKS heavy and he will break down questions in the notes. However, he does not post notes online, fix ALEKS grades, or respond in a hasty manner.

This class is hard but very passable. I spend hours on ALEK's doing practice problems, and I go over my notes every night before bed. If you go to lecture and put in the work at home, you will thrive in this class. As someone who has hated and struggled with math her entire life, Professor Shildneck has truly made me fall in love with calculus.
